com.google.appinventor.server.util

Class ModifiedHeaders

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.appinventor.server.util.ModifiedHeaders

  • public class ModifiedHeaders
extends Object
    Utility class for dealing with "If-Modified-Since" and "Last-Modified" headers for servlet requests and responses.
    Author:
    sharon@google.com (Sharon Perl)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ModifiedHeaders() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean notModified(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
      Compares the "If-Modified-Since" header in this request (ir present) to the last build date (if known) in order to determine whether the requested data has been modified since the prior request.
      static void setHeaders(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
      Sets headers such that, if the last build time is known, it is included in the "Last-Modified" header and validation is required for reuse.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • ModifiedHeaders

        public ModifiedHeaders()

    • Method Detail

      • notModified

        public static boolean notModified(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest req)
        Compares the "If-Modified-Since" header in this request (ir present) to the last build date (if known) in order to determine whether the requested data has been modified since the prior request.
        Parameters:
        req - the request
        Returns:
        true iff we're sure that request is for a resource that has not been modified since the prior request

      • setHeaders

        public static void setHeaders(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse resp)
        Sets headers such that, if the last build time is known, it is included in the "Last-Modified" header and validation is required for reuse. If the build time is not known, this makes the response uncacheable.
        Parameters:
        resp - the response
